titleStmt.title: Martin Lawson vs. King County. In re War Hawk.

bibl.title: Martin Lawson vs. King County. In re War Hawk.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

div1.p: and 8 other Seaman belonging to the American ship War Hawk, being, Martin Lawson, John Strom, Christ Anderson, Thomas Henwood, Ellias Krebs, Edward Haquer, John Nickels, Peter Nelson and Victor Martinson having been accused of coertion and having absented themselves from the said ship War Hawk by the

Therereof and after an lasting five days before the undersigned one of the Justices of the peace in and for said King County the following could arrived up to and now this 14th day December U.S. 1876 is appearing to this court that on 9th 1876 they the aforesaid and absented themselves without leave a permission of the master or other officer of said american ship, War Hawk (commanding of the lives of the said without leave and that they had duly
signed what purpose to the shipping where of the said American ship War Hawk and that the voyage contracted for is not finished or altered as set forth in said article of agreement on otherwise disolved his considered ordered and adjudged that the said defendant he committed in the jail of King County W. J. to remain there and to the said ship War Hawk shall be ready to go to Sea until the said Master there of shall require their discharge and that said defendant there be discovered by the marshal or other officer having which in charged to the master of the said ship war hawk on board of said ship. He the said Master paying all the costs of this suit the same to be from wages due to said defendats and that there he of wages for any time that said defendants have been in custody during his trial but that but that the said defendants forfiet their wages and so much of him as is neccessary to pay more to work in their place during the 2 days that they were absent for labour before arrest therefore in his name of the United States your Charles P
Hopkins United States Marshal of Washington Territory as hereby commanded to receive with your custody the aforesaid defendants and will commit here to the county jail of said King County W. J. Wyckoff safely keeep and to action the said dependants to the said Master of the said ship War Hawk in persuance of the aforesaid jurisdiction and declare the said master to pay her for following and accuring cash on a before the authority of the said defendant to the charged of the said Marshal
Sworn under my hand this 14th day of December A. D. 1876 D. S. Smith J. P.
a true copy Charles Hopkins Aud. Marshal W. S. By L. V. Wyckoff Deputy
